definition: Yellow Peril, political novel by Wang Lixiong 王力雄[Wang2 Li4 xiong2]
yellow peril (offensive term referring to the perceived threat to Western nations, of immigration or military expansion from East Asian nations)

sentences.english: We once thought of China as the "yellow peril" and then the "red menace."
sentences.chinese: 我们曾视中国为“黄祸”，继而视之为“红色威胁”。

sentences.english: Inside every China sceptic is a prophet of the New Yellow Peril waiting to be let out.
sentences.chinese: 每个中国怀疑论者都有一个呼之欲出的新黄祸的预言。

sentences.english: Already, Russian politicians exploit the "yellow peril" fear.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯的政治家们已经开始利用对“黄祸”的恐惧。

sentences.english: When we were the Sick Man of Bsia, We were called The Yellow Peril.
sentences.chinese: 当咱们照旧亚洲弱国的时辰，咱们被叫做黄祸。

sentences.english: When we were the Sick Man of Asia, We were called the Yellow Peril.
sentences.chinese: 曾经我们是东亚病夫，我们被叫成黄祸。

sentences.english: Fears of a “yellow peril” stalked Europe.
sentences.chinese: 对“黄祸”的恐惧一时散布欧洲。

definition: to feel animosity toward foreigners or outsiders/xenophobia

pinyin: she4 hui4 Da2 er3 wen2 zhu3 yi4

definition: Great East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere, Japanese wartime slogan for their short-lived Pacific Empire, first enunciated by Prime Minister Prince KONOE Fumimaro 近衛文麿|近卫文麿 in 1938
pinyin: Da4 Dong1 ya4 Gong4 rong2 quan1
